title: How to Make Pizza Skulls

steps.headline: Grease a 3D mini shaped skull pan with butter.
Whisk together the egg and warm water until fully combined.
Roll out the pizza dough with a rolling pin.
steps.description: You may need to flour the surface or rolling pin to prevent the dough from sticking.

steps.headline: Carefully slice the dough into equally sized pieces.
steps.description: Depending on the size of your skull pan, you may need to make the pieces big for a deep pan or a little smaller for a flat pan.

steps.headline: Place the pieces of dough into the skull pan.
steps.description: Gently push them in the cases of the pan. There should be some excess dough, leaving the dough tops staying around the opening.

steps.headline: Stuff the skull pizzas with your desired toppings.
steps.description: Add a few tablespoons of tomato sauce into each case of dough. Add the desired amount of shredded mozzarella cheese and other pizza toppings.

steps.headline: Close the skull pizzas together.
steps.description: Cut off the excess dough around the tops. Pinch the dough seams together with the egg wash so they can close properly and not reopen while baking. Brush egg wash over the skulls once more. The leftover excess pizza dough can be used to make more skull pizzas, but the small amount of dough may cause the sauce to ooze out from the cracks.

steps.headline: Allow the pizza skulls to chill in the fridge for half an hour.
Preheat your oven to 375° Fahrenheit (190° Celsius).
Bake the pizza skulls for about 18-20 minutes in the oven.
steps.description: The pizza dough should look golden brown and fully baked.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Remove the pizza skulls from the pan once cool. Place them on a serving plate and enjoy!

text: Grease a 3D mini shaped skull pan with butter.  Whisk together the egg and warm water until fully combined. Set aside for later use. Roll out the pizza dough with a rolling pin. You may need to flour the surface or rolling pin to prevent the dough from sticking. Carefully slice the dough into equally sized pieces. Depending on the size of your skull pan, you may need to make the pieces big for a deep pan or a little smaller for a flat pan. Place the pieces of dough into the skull pan. Gently push them in the cases of the pan. There should be some excess dough, leaving the dough tops staying around the opening. Stuff the skull pizzas with your desired toppings. Add a few tablespoons of tomato sauce into each case of dough. Add the desired amount of shredded mozzarella cheese and other pizza toppings. Close the skull pizzas together. Cut off the excess dough around the tops. Pinch the dough seams together with the egg wash so they can close properly and not reopen while baking. Brush egg wash over the skulls once more. The leftover excess pizza dough can be used to make more skull pizzas, but the small amount of dough may cause the sauce to ooze out from the cracks. Allow the pizza skulls to chill in the fridge for half an hour.  Preheat your oven to 375° Fahrenheit (190° Celsius).  Bake the pizza skulls for about 18-20 minutes in the oven. The pizza dough should look golden brown and fully baked. Serve. Remove the pizza skulls from the pan once cool. Place them on a serving plate and enjoy!
